abstract: Liberty Global, the U.S.-based communications company controlled by John Malone, said Monday that it would sell its stake in Jupiter Telecommunications of Japan to KDDI Corp., a Japanese wireless operator, for $4 billion.
snippet: Liberty Global, the U.S.-based communications company controlled by John Malone, said Monday that it would sell its stake in Jupiter Telecommunications of Japan to KDDI Corp., a Japanese wireless operator, for $4 billion.
lead_paragraph: Liberty Global, the United States-based communications company controlled by John Malone, said Monday that it would sell its stake in Jupiter Telecommunications of Japan to KDDI Corporation, a Japanese wireless operator, for $4 billion.

headline.main: KDDI Pays $4 Billion for Liberty’s Stake in Japanese Cable Company
